intro: Parosela vulneraria, commonly known as the wounded plant or the bleeding heart plant, is a member of the Violaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring. Its scientific name reflects its historical use in traditional medicine for treating wounds. The plant's botanical characteristics make it both ecologically significant and of interest in horticultural studies.
